This is the main simulation function

Source: R/run_H1D_simulation.R
run.H1D.simulation.Rd

This is the main simulation function

run.H1D.simulation(
  project.path,
  hydrus.path = NULL,
  profile.depth,
  beginT,
  endT,
  deltaT,
  bot.bc.type,
  bot.bc.value,
  const.bot.bc,
  soil.para,
  atm.bc.data,
  ini.wt,
  TimeUnit = "days",
  rdepth,
  watertable_depth,
  obs.nodes,
  show.output = TRUE
)

Arguments

project.path

project.path

hydrus.path

hydrus.path

profile.depth

profile.depth

beginT

beginT

endT

end time

deltaT

time step

bot.bc.type

head or flux type

bot.bc.value

value of the bc

const.bot.bc

Logical, to set if bottom BC is constant

soil.para

Hydraulic parameters of soil (van Genuchten)

atm.bc.data

data frame containing atmonspheric boundary conditions (time variable BC)

ini.wt

Initial water table depth

TimeUnit

default: "days"

rdepth

rooting depth

watertable_depth

Depth of water table (to assign hydrostatic initial condition)

obs.nodes

Observation node points (vector)

show.output

Logical, whether the shell output of HYDRUS1D run should be displayed on R console, default = F
